result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Acknowledgment by Bail Depositor
Amended Bail Bond

No contact with any alleged victims or their residences. 
No contact with victims under statute 940.47. 
Not have a passport and if Defendant does have one, passport to be surrendered to the Langlade County Sheriff's Department. 
May not leave the State of Wisconsin without the permission of the Court.

10:31 AM/Room 301.  Defendant Scott L. Huse appeared by video, via Zoom, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Wright C. Laufenberg in court, in person, for Scott L. Huse.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert, in court, in person for State of Wisconsin. Court has reviewed motion. Attny Laufenberg heard on bond modification request. Attny Laufenberg shows Court documentation as to suggested amount that could be posted. Response by State, objects to request. State indicates victims object to modification. Response by Attny Laufenberg. Remarks by the Court. The Court grants modification, lowers to $75,000 cash bond with same conditions: No contact with any alleged victims or their residences. No contact with victims under statute 940.47. Not have a passport and if he does have one, it must be surrendered to the Langlade County Sheriff's Dept. May not leave the State of Wisconsin without the permission of the Court. STC to be set for Nov. 21, 2022 at 11 a.m. Additional scheduling may be held with JA if needed.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court calls  @ 01:08 PM, Held in Room 301 Defendant Scott L. Huse in court with attorney Wright C. Laufenberg.  Defendant Scott L. Huse in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott L. Huse appeared by video means with Attorney, via zoom.  Victim present in courtroom and victims via zoom.  Atty Laufenberg has copy of complaint, waives reading, Def. has copy of criminal complaint.  Bail/bond has already be set.  Atty Laufenberg not addressing bail/bond today.  Atty Laufenberg heard on victim ID.  State heard on victim ID key and will provide to defense.  Atty Laufenberg is requesting timely preliminary hearing.  Bond remains.  Court orders State to file victim ID key promptly.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/Bond

No contact with any alleged victims or their residence.
No contact with victims under statute 940.47.

Court calls @ 1:31 pm in Rm 301.  Defendant Scott Huse appears via zoom from Langlade County Jail with Atty Wright Laufenberg in court.  Elizabeth Gebert, appears in court. State advise commissioner that CC has reviewed a riverside and now has 2 alleged victims. Court notes a number of victims appears via zoom and present in courtroom.  State advise bail bond hearing only.  State being held on child sexual assaults, 2nd degree & 1st degree, State gives facts for probable cause and gives bail/bond recommendation, 1000000 cash bond with conditions No contact with any alleged victim or residence & no contact with victims under statute 940.47.  DA will advise counsel of victims and file victim key with COC and have it sealed. Atty Laufenberg gives bail bond argument, Def. doesn't have a passport. DA heard on national church organization. Response by Atty Laufenberg.  Court orders $250,000 cash bond with conditions of no contact with any alleged victims or their residence and no contact with victims under statute 940.47.
